input: What happens if alternate air flow rates are specified for cooling heating and when no cooling or heating is required?
output: The design supply air mass flow rate is the maximum of these specified values.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How is the compressor part-load ratio reported for the HeatCool version?
output: The compressor part-load ratio is reported as the ratio of the actual cooling load to the full-load sensible capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: Which components report variables of interest like heating rate cooling rate and energy consumption for the furnace?
output: Reporting of other variables of interest for the furnace is done by the individual system components (fan heating coil and DX cooling coil).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the purpose of the furnace model?
output: The sole purpose of the furnace model is to properly coordinate the operation of the various system components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What configurations does the furnace model describe?
output: The furnace model describes the HeatOnly and HeatCool configurations as well as the differences between cycling and continuous supply air fan operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does the HeatOnly configuration consist of?
output: The HeatOnly configuration consists of an on/off or constant volume fan and an electric or gas heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is done when the model is first called during an EnergyPlus simulation?
output: All of the input data specified for each furnace in the input data file are read into data structures for use throughout the remainder of the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the first step when modeling the performance of a heat-only furnace during a simulation time step?
output: The first step is to retrieve the heating load required to meet the thermostat setpoint for the control zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/engineering-reference/media/
input: What figure is referenced for understanding the furnace operation?
output: Figure~\\reffig:schematic-of-the-energyplus-furnace-blow. Schematic of the EnergyPlus Furnace.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: Where can more details regarding load calculations be found?
output: More details regarding load calculations can be found in the section \Summary of Predictor-Corrector Procedure\ elsewhere in this document.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is reported by individual system components for the furnace?
output: Reporting of other variables of interest for the furnace (heating rate cooling rate energy consumption etc.) is done by the individual system components (fan heating coil and DX cooling coil).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Model Description -> text
input: What is the purpose of the furnace model?
output: The sole purpose of the furnace model is to properly coordinate the operation of the various system components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Model Description -> text
input: What configurations does the furnace model describe?
output: The furnace model describes the flow of information within the model for both the HeatOnly and HeatCool configurations as well as the differences between cycling and continuous supply air fan operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Model Description -> text
input: What does the last section of the model description cover?
output: The last section describes the optional control of high zone humidity with a reheat coil for the HeatCool configuration.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What does the HeatOnly configuration consist of?
output: The HeatOnly configuration consists of an on/off or constant volume fan and an electric or gas heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What happens when the model is first called during an EnergyPlus simulation?
output: When the model is first called during an EnergyPlus simulation all of the input data specified for each furnace in the input data file are read into data structures for use throughout the remainder of the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What is the first step for each simulation time step when modeling a heat-only furnace?
output: The first step is to retrieve the heating load required to meet the thermostat setpoint for the 'control' zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: Where can more details regarding load calculations be found?
output: More details regarding load calculations can be found in the section 'Summary of Predictor-Corrector Procedure' elsewhere in this document.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/engineering-reference/media/
input: What does Figure~\\reffig:schematic-of-the-energyplus-furnace-blow depict?
output: Figure~\\reffig:schematic-of-the-energyplus-furnace-blow depicts the schematic of the EnergyPlus Furnace.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> equation
input: What is the equation for determining the total heating load to be met by the furnace?
output: Furnace~Heating~Load = \\fracControl~Zone~Heating~LoadControl~Zone~Air~Flow~Fraction

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What does the model calculate after determining the total heating load?
output: The model calculates the furnace's sensible heating energy rate delivered to the zones being served when the system runs at full-load conditions and when the heating coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What happens to the sensible heating energy rate if the supply air fan cycles on and off with the heater?
output: If the supply air fan cycles on and off with the heater then the sensible heating energy rate is zero when the heating coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What happens to the sensible heating energy rate if the fan runs continuously?
output: If the fan is scheduled to run continuously regardless of coil operation then the sensible heating energy rate will not be zero when the heating coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What does calculating the sensible heating energy rate involve?
output: Calculating the sensible heating energy rate involves modeling the supply air fan (and associated fan heat) and the heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> equation
input: What is the equation for the full heat output delivered by the furnace?
output: Full~Heat~Output = (Mass~Flow~Rate_full~load)(h_outfull~load - h_control~zone)_HRmin - \\Delta_senfull~load

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> equation
input: What is the equation for the no heat output delivered by the furnace?
output: No~Heat~Output = (Mass~Flow~Rate_coil~off)(h_outcoil~off - h_control~zone)_HRmin - \\Delta_sencoil~off

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What is Mass Flow Rate\\(_full~load\\)?
output: Mass Flow Rate\\(_full~load\\) is the air mass flow rate through furnace at full-load conditions (kg/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What is h\\(_outfull~load\\)?
output: h\\(_outfull~load\\) is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace at full-load conditions (J/kg).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What is h\\(_control~zone\\)?
output: h\\(_control~zone\\) is the enthalpy of air in the control zone where thermostat is located (J/kg).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What are HR\\(_min\\)?
output: HR\\(_min\\) are the enthalpies evaluated at a constant humidity ratio the minimum humidity ratio of the furnace exiting air or the air in the control zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What is Mass Flow Rate\\(_coil~off\\)?
output: Mass Flow Rate\\(_coil~off\\) is the air mass flow rate through the furnace with the heating coil OFF (kg/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What is h\\(_outcoil~off\\)?
output: h\\(_outcoil~off\\) is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace with the heating coil OFF (J/kg).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: HeatOnly Configuration -> text
input: What is \\(\\Delta_senfull~load\\)?
output: \\(\\Delta_senfull~load\\) is the sensible load difference between the system output node and the zone inlet node at full-load conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the formula for Control Zone Heating Load?
output: = \\fracControl~Zone~Heating~LoadControl~Zone~Air~Flow~Fraction

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does the model calculate regarding the furnace's sensible heating energy rate?
output: The model then calculates the furnace's sensible heating energy rate delivered to the zones being served when the system runs at full-load conditions and when the heating coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens to the sensible heating energy rate if the supply air fan cycles on and off with the heater?
output: If the supply air fan cycles on and off with the heater then the sensible heating energy rate is zero when the heating coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens to the sensible heating energy rate if the fan is scheduled to run continuously regardless of coil operation?
output: If the fan is scheduled to run continuously regardless of coil operation then the sensible heating energy rate will not be zero when the heating coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does calculating the sensible heating energy rate involve?
output: Calculating the sensible heating energy rate involves modeling the supply air fan (and associated fan heat) and the heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How is the sensible heating energy rate delivered by the furnace calculated for full load and heating coil OFF?
output: For each of these cases (full load and heating coil OFF) the sensible heating energy rate delivered by the furnace is calculated as follows:

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for Full Heat Output?
output: Full~Heat~Output = (Mass~Flow~Rate_full~load)(h_outfull~load - h_control~zone)_HRmin - \\Delta_senfull~load

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for No Heat Output?
output: No~Heat~Output = (Mass~Flow~Rate_coil~off)(h_outcoil~off - h_control~zone)_HRmin - \\Delta_sencoil~off

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is Mass Flow Rate full load?
output: Mass Flow Rate\\(_full~load\\) is the air mass flow rate through furnace at full-load conditions (kg/s)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is h out full load?
output: h\\(_outfull~load\\) is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace at full-load conditions (J/kg)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is h control zone?
output: h\\(_control~zone\\) is the enthalpy of air in the control zone where thermostat is located (J/kg)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What are HR min?
output: HR\\(_min\\) are the enthalpies evaluated at a constant humidity ratio the minimum humidity ratio of the furnace exiting air or the air in the control zone

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is Mass Flow Rate coil off?
output: Mass Flow Rate\\(_coil~off\\) is the air mass flow rate through the furnace with the heating coil OFF (kg/s)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is h out coil off?
output: h\\(_outcoil~off\\) is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace with the heating coil OFF (J/kg)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is Delta sen full load?
output: \\(\\Delta_senfull~load\\) is the sensible load difference between the system output node and the zone inlet node at full-load conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for Delta sen full load?
output: \\beginarrayrl   \\Delta_senfull~load &= \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outfull~load - h_Zone~Inlet_HRmin \\\\              &+ \\PB\\dotm_full~load - \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outfull~load - h_Control~Zone_HRmin  \\endarray

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is Frac?
output: Frac is the control zone air fraction with respect to the system mass flow rate

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is Delta sen coil off?
output: \\(\\Delta_sencoil~off\\) is the sensible load difference between the system output node and the zone inlet node with the heating coil OFF conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for Delta sen coil off?
output: \\beginarrayrl   \\Delta_sencoil~off &= \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outcoil~off - h_Zone~Inlet_HRmin \\\\              &+ \\PB\\dotm_coil~off - \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outcoil~off - h_Control~Zone_HRmin  \\endarray

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is done with the calculated sensible heating energy rates and the total sensible heating load to be met by the system?
output: With the calculated sensible heating energy rates and the total sensible heating load to be met by the system the part-load ratio for the furnace is estimated.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the formula for PartLoadRatio?
output: PartLoadRatio = MAX\\left( 0.0MIN\\left( 1.0\\fracABS\\left( FurnaceHeatingLoad - NoHeatOutput \\right)ABS(FullHeatOutput - NoHeatOutput) \\right) \\right)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the part-load ratio used for?
output: The part-load ratio calculated above is used to determine the required heating coil capacity as \\(Qheating\\coil = Qdesign\\*PartLoadRatio\\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is Q design?
output: Q\\(_design\\) is the nominal heating coil capacity as specified in the heating coil object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if the fan cycles on and off with the heating coil?
output: If the fan cycles on and off with the heating coil (i.e. when the supply air fan operating mode schedule values are equal to 0) then this part-load ratio is also used to determine the operating mass flow rate of the furnace as \\(\\dot m_furnace = \\dot m_design*PartLoadRatio\\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if the fan operates continuously?
output: If the fan operates continuously (i.e.~fan ON) the operating mass flow rate is specified as \\(\\dot m_design\\) .

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is done after determining the operating mass flow rate?
output: The furnace's fan and heating coil are then re-simulated to determine the furnace's delivered sensible heating capacity at the above calculated part-load ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for the full-load sensible load difference?
output: \\Delta_senfull~load = \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outfull~load - h_Zone~Inlet_HRmin + \\PB\\dotm_full~load - \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outfull~load - h_Control~Zone_HRmin

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does 'Frac' represent in the context of the equation?
output: Frac is the control zone air fraction with respect to the system mass flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is \\(\\Delta_sencoil~off\\)?
output: \\(\\Delta_sencoil~off\\) is the sensible load difference between the system output node and the zone inlet node with the heating coil OFF conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for the sensible load difference with the heating coil off?
output: \\Delta_sencoil~off = \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outcoil~off - h_Zone~Inlet_HRmin + \\PB\\dotm_coil~off - \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outcoil~off - h_Control~Zone_HRmin

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How is the part-load ratio for the furnace estimated?
output: With the calculated sensible heating energy rates and the total sensible heating load to be met by the system the part-load ratio for the furnace is estimated.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for calculating the part-load ratio?
output: PartLoadRatio = MAX\\left( 0.0MIN\\left( 1.0\\fracABS\\left( FurnaceHeatingLoad - NoHeatOutput \\right)ABS(FullHeatOutput - NoHeatOutput) \\right) \\right)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How is the required heating coil capacity determined?
output: The part-load ratio calculated above is used to determine the required heating coil capacity as \\(Qheating\\coil = Qdesign\\*PartLoadRatio\\) where \\emphQ\\(_design\\) is the nominal heating coil capacity as specified in the heating coil object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if the fan cycles on and off with the heating coil?
output: If the fan cycles on and off with the heating coil (i.e. when the supply air fan operating mode schedule values are equal to 0) then this part-load ratio is also used to determine the operating mass flow rate of the furnace as \\(\\dot m_furnace = \\dot m_design*PartLoadRatio\\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the operating mass flow rate if the fan operates continuously?
output: If the fan operates continuously (i.e.~fan ON) the operating mass flow rate is specified as \\(\\dot m_design\\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is done after determining the part-load ratio?
output: The furnace's fan and heating coil are then re-simulated to determine the furnace's delivered sensible heating capacity at the above-calculated part-load ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for the furnace's delivered sensible heating capacity?
output: Q_furnace = \\left( \\dot m_furnace \\right)\\left( h_outactual - h_control~zone \\right)_HRmin - \\Delta_senactual

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What are the terms in the equation for \\(Q_furnace\\)?
output: \\(Q_furnace\\) is the sensible heating capacity delivered by the furnace (W) \\(\\dot m_furnace\\) is the air mass flow rate through the furnace (kg/s) \\emphh\\(_out\\ actual\\) is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace (J/kg) \\emphh\\(_out\\ control\\ zone\\) is the enthalpy of air in the control zone (J/kg) \\emphHR\\(_min\\) are the enthalpies evaluated at a constant humidity ratio the minimum humidity ratio of the furnace exiting air or the air in the control zone \\(\\Delta_senactual\\) is the sensible load difference between the system output node and the zone inlet node at the above-calculated part-load ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for the actual sensible load difference?
output: \\Delta_senactual = \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outactual - h_Zone~Inlet_HRmin + \\PB\\dotm_furnace - \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outactual - h_Control~Zone_HRmin

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How is the final part-load ratio for the heating coil and fan determined?
output: Since the part-load performance of the heating coil can be non-linear and the supply air fan heat varies based on heating coil operation for the case of cycling fan/cycling coil (AUTO fan) the final part-load ratio for the heating coil and fan are determined through iterative calculations (successive modeling of the heating coil and fan) until the furnace's heating output matches the heating load to be met within the heating convergence tolerance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the convergence tolerance for the heating load?
output: The convergence tolerance is fixed at 0.001 and is calculated based on the difference between the load to be met and the furnace's heating output divided by the load to be met.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for calculating the tolerance?
output: Tolerance \\equiv \\fracFurnaceHeatingLoad - Q_furnaceFurnaceHeatingLoad \\leq 0.001

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How is the average air mass flow rate determined if the furnace has a cycling fan/cycling coil?
output: If the furnace has been specified with cycling fan/cycling coil (AUTO fan) then the furnace's design air mass flow rate is multiplied by PartLoadRatio to determine the average air mass flow rate for the system simulation time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for the sensible heating capacity delivered by the furnace?
output: Q_furnace = \\dotm_furnace \\left( h_outactual - h_control~zone \\right)_HRmin - \\Delta_senactual

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does \(Q_furnace\) represent?
output: Q_furnace is the sensible heating capacity delivered by the furnace (W).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does \(\dot m_furnace\) represent?
output: \(\dot m_furnace\) is the air mass flow rate through the furnace (kg/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does \(h_out\ actual\) represent?
output: h_out\ actual is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace (J/kg).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does \(h_out\ control\ zone\) represent?
output: h_out\ control\ zone is the enthalpy of air in the control zone (J/kg).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does \(HR_min\) represent?
output: HR_min are the enthalpies evaluated at a constant humidity ratio the minimum humidity ratio of the furnace exiting air or the air in the control zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does \(\Delta_senactual\) represent?
output: \(\Delta_senactual\) is the sensible load difference between the system output node and the zone inlet node at the above calculated part-load ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for \(\Delta_senactual\)?
output:
\beginarrayrl 
\Delta_senactual &= \frac\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \PBh_Outactual - h_Zone~Inlet_HRmin \\
             &+ \PB\dotm_furnace - \frac\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \PBh_Outactual - h_Control~Zone_HRmin 
\endarray

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: Why are iterative calculations used in determining the part-load ratio for the heating coil and fan?
output: Iterative calculations are used because the part-load performance of the heating coil can be non-linear and the supply air fan heat varies based on heating coil operation for the case of cycling fan/cycling coil (AUTO fan).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the convergence tolerance for the heating coil and fan part-load ratio calculations?
output: The convergence tolerance is fixed at 0.001.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for calculating the tolerance in part-load ratio calculations?
output: Tolerance \\equiv \\fracFurnaceHeatingLoad - Q_furnaceFurnaceHeatingLoad \\leq 0.001

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How is the average air mass flow rate determined if the furnace has a cycling fan/cycling coil (AUTO fan)?
output: The furnace's design air mass flow rate is multiplied by PartLoadRatio to determine the average air mass flow rate for the system simulation time step.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if the supply air fan is specified to run continuously (fan ON)?
output: The air mass flow rate remains at the furnace's design air mass flow rate and the air conditions at nodes downstream of the heating coil are calculated as the average conditions over the simulation time step.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What occurs when the furnace is scheduled to operate with continuous supply air fan operation but no heating load is required?
output: The supply air fan model is called to determine the fan exiting air conditions and the heating coil model passes the inlet air conditions and mass flow rate from its inlet node to its outlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is done with the air exiting the heating coil?
output: The air exiting the heating coil is sent to the direct air units for distribution to each zone served by the furnace where the zone heat balance is performed to determine the resulting zone air conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How are the furnace exiting air conditions and energy consumption calculated and reported?
output: They are calculated and reported by the individual component models (fan and heating coil).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does the HeatCool configuration consist of?
output: The HeatCool configuration consists of an on/off or constant volume fan a DX cooling coil and an electric or gas heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the difference in air mass flow rate during no cooling/heating operation with continuous supply air fan operation for the HeatCool configuration?
output: The air mass flow rate can be different from the air mass flow rate during heater operation for the HeatCool configuration.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What do the air conditions at nodes downstream of the heating coil represent?
output: The air conditions at nodes downstream of the heating coil represent the full-load (steady-state) values when the coil is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens to the air mass flow rate if the supply air fan is specified to run continuously?
output: If the supply air fan is specified to run continuously (fan ON) then the air mass flow rate remains at the furnace's design air mass flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How are the air conditions at nodes downstream of the heating coil calculated when the supply air fan runs continuously?
output: The air conditions at nodes downstream of the heating coil are calculated as the average conditions over the simulation time step which is the weighted average of full-load conditions when the coil is operating and inlet air conditions when the coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens when the furnace is scheduled to operate with a continuous supply air fan but no heating load is required?
output: The supply air fan model is called to determine the fan exiting air conditions and the heating coil model is called but simply passes the inlet air conditions and mass flow rate from its inlet node to its outlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: Where is the air exiting the heating coil sent?
output: The air exiting the heating coil is sent to the direct air units for distribution to each zone served by the furnace.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How are the furnace exiting air conditions and energy consumption calculated?
output: The furnace exiting air conditions and energy consumption are calculated and reported by the individual component models (fan and heating coil).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does the HeatCool configuration consist of?
output: The HeatCool configuration consists of an on/off or constant volume fan a DX cooling coil and an electric or gas heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How does the model for the HeatCool configuration handle cases where a heating load is calculated?
output: For cases where a heating load is calculated the model follows nearly identical computational steps as described in the HeatOnly Configuration section.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the main difference in the HeatCool configuration regarding air mass flow rate?
output: The main difference is that the air mass flow rate during no cooling/heating operation with continuous supply air fan operation can be different from the air mass flow rate during heater operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if a cooling load is calculated by EnergyPlus for the control zone?
output: If a cooling load is calculated the solution methodology is virtually identical to heating load cases and the model computes the total sensible cooling load to be met by the furnace.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation used to calculate the Furnace Cooling Load?
output: Furnace~Cooling~Load = \\fracControl~Zone~Cooling~LoadControl~Zone~Air~Flow~Fraction

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does the model check if the supply air fan operating mode schedule requests cycling fan operation?
output: The model first checks for the presence of an economizer in the outside air system serving the furnace's air loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if an air-side economizer is used and active?
output: The furnace will try to meet the cooling load by operating only the supply air fan and if the fan satisfies the cooling load the compressor remains off for the entire simulation time step.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if the operation of the fan alone is unable to meet the entire cooling load?
output: The compressor is enabled and additional calculations are performed to determine the compressor's part-load ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How does the model calculate the furnace's sensible cooling energy rate?
output: The model calculates the furnace's sensible cooling energy rate delivered to the zones when the system runs at full-load conditions and when the DX cooling coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if the supply air fan cycles with the compressor?
output: The sensible cooling energy rate is zero when the cooling coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if the fan is configured to run continuously regardless of coil operation?
output: The sensible cooling energy rate will probably not be zero when the cooling coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How is the load calculated by EnergyPlus for the control zone?
output: The load is calculated by EnergyPlus for the control zone using a solution methodology that is virtually identical to the one described for completeness.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if EnergyPlus determines that the furnace must supply cooling to the control zone?
output: If EnergyPlus determines that the furnace must supply cooling to the control zone to meet the zone air temperature setpoint the model computes the total sensible cooling load to be met by the furnace based on the control zone sensible cooling load and the fraction of the furnace air flow that goes through the control zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for the Furnace Cooling Load?
output: Furnace~Cooling~Load = \\fracControl~Zone~Cooling~LoadControl~Zone~Air~Flow~Fraction

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does the model check first if the supply air fan operating mode schedule requests cycling fan operation?
output: The model first checks for the presence of an economizer in the outside air system serving the furnace's air loop (Ref. AirLoopHVAC:OutdoorAirSystem).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if an outside air system is not present or if an air-side economizer is not used?
output: If an outside air system is not present or if an air-side economizer is not used the furnace's compressor is used to meet the furnace cooling load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What occurs if an air-side economizer is used and is active?
output: If an air-side economizer is used and is active the furnace will try to meet the cooling load by operating only the supply air fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if the fan is able to satisfy the furnace cooling load?
output: If the fan is able to satisfy the furnace cooling load the compressor remains off for the entire simulation time step.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if the operation of the fan alone is unable to meet the entire cooling load?
output: If the operation of the fan alone is unable to meet the entire cooling load then the compressor is enabled and additional calculations are performed to determine the compressor's part-load ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does the model calculate when the system runs at full-load conditions and when the DX cooling coil is OFF?
output: The model calculates the furnace's sensible cooling energy rate delivered to the zones being served when the system runs at full-load conditions and when the DX cooling coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the sensible cooling energy rate if the supply air fan cycles with the compressor and the cooling coil is OFF?
output: If the supply air fan cycles with the compressor then the sensible cooling energy rate is zero when the cooling coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the sensible cooling energy rate if the fan is configured to run continuously regardless of coil operation?
output: If the fan is configured to run continuously regardless of coil operation then the sensible cooling energy rate will probably not be zero when the cooling coil is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does calculating the sensible cooling energy rate involve?
output: Calculating the sensible cooling energy rate involves modeling the supply air fan (and associated fan heat) the DX cooling coil and the heating coil (simply to pass the air properties and mass flow rate from its inlet node to its outlet node).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for the Full Cool Output?
output: Full~Cool~Output = (Mass~Flow~Rate_full~load)(h_outfull~load - h_control~zone)_HRmin - \\Delta_senfull~load

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for the No Cool Output?
output: No~Cool~Output = (Mass~Flow~Rate_coil~off)(h_outcoil~off - h_control~zone)_HRmin - \\Delta_sencoil~off

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the air mass flow rate through the furnace at full-load conditions?
output: Mass Flow Rate\(_full~load\) is the air mass flow rate through the furnace at full-load conditions (kg/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace at full-load conditions?
output: h\(_outfull~load\) is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace at full-load conditions (J/kg).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the enthalpy of air in the control zone?
output: h\(_control~zone\) is the enthalpy of air in the control zone (where thermostat is located) (J/kg).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What are HR\(_min\)?
output: HR\(_min\) are the enthalpies evaluated at a constant humidity ratio the minimum humidity ratio of the furnace exiting air or the air in the control zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the air mass flow rate through the furnace with the cooling coil OFF?
output: Mass Flow Rate\(_coil~off\) is the air mass flow rate through the furnace with the cooling coil OFF (kg/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace with the cooling coil OFF?
output: h\(_outcoil~off\) is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace with the cooling coil OFF (J/kg).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is \\(\\Delta_senfull~load\\)?
output: \\(\\Delta_senfull~load\\) is the sensible load difference between the system output node and the zone inlet node at full-load conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for \\(\\Delta_senfull~load\\)?
output: \\beginarrayrl \\Delta_senfull~load &= \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outfull~load - h_Zone~Inlet_HRmin \\\\ &+ \\PB\\dotm_full~load - \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outfull~load - h_Control~Zone_HRmin \\endarray

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is Frac?
output: Frac is the control zone air fraction with respect to the system mass flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does the cooling energy rate modeling involve?
output: The cooling energy rate involves modeling the supply air fan (and associated fan heat) the DX cooling coil and the heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is calculated for each case (full load and DX cooling coil OFF) in the context of the furnace?
output: The sensible cooling energy rate delivered by the furnace is calculated.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for Full Cool Output?
output: Full~Cool~Output = (Mass~Flow~Rate_full~load)(h_outfull~load - h_control~zone)_HRmin - \Delta_senfull~load

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for No Cool Output?
output: No~Cool~Output = (Mass~Flow~Rate_coil~off)(h_outcoil~off - h_control~zone)_HRmin - \Delta_sencoil~off

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the Mass Flow Rate at full load conditions?
output: Mass Flow Rate\(_full~load\) is the air mass flow rate through furnace at full-load conditions (kg/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace at full-load conditions?
output: h\(_outfull~load\) is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace at full-load conditions (J/kg).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the enthalpy of air in the control zone?
output: h\(_control~zone\) is the enthalpy of air in the control zone (where thermostat is located) (J/kg).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What are HR\(_min\)?
output: HR\(_min\) are the enthalpies evaluated at a constant humidity ratio the minimum humidity ratio of the furnace exiting air or the air in the control zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the Mass Flow Rate with the cooling coil OFF?
output: Mass Flow Rate\(_coil~off\) is the air mass flow rate through the furnace with the cooling coil OFF (kg/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace with the cooling coil OFF?
output: h\(_outcoil~off\) is the enthalpy of air exiting the furnace with the cooling coil OFF (J/kg).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is \(\Delta_senfull~load\)?
output: \(\Delta_senfull~load\) is the sensible load difference between the system output node and the zone inlet node at full-load conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for \(\Delta_senfull~load\)?
output: \Delta_senfull~load = \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outfull~load - h_Zone~Inlet_HRmin + \\PB\\dotm_full~load - \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outfull~load - h_Control~Zone_HRmin

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What does Frac represent?
output: Frac is the control zone air fraction with respect to the system mass flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is \(\Delta_sencoil~off\)?
output: \(\Delta_sencoil~off\) is the sensible load difference between the system output node and the zone inlet node with the heating coil OFF conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for \(\Delta_sencoil~off\)?
output: \Delta_sencoil~off = \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outcoil~off - h_Zone~Inlet_HRmin + \\PB\\dotm_coil~off - \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outcoil~off - h_Control~Zone_HRmin

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is estimated with the calculated sensible cooling energy rates and the total sensible cooling load?
output: The part-load ratio for the furnace is estimated.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for PartLoadRatio?
output: PartLoadRatio = MAX\\left( 0.0\\fracABS\\left( FurnaceCoolingLoad - NoCoolOutput \\right)ABS\\left( FullCoolOutput - NoCoolOutput \\right) \\right)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: Why are iterative calculations performed to determine the final part-load ratio for the cooling coil compressor and fan?
output: Iterative calculations are performed because the part-load performance of the DX cooling coil is frequently non-linear and the supply air fan heat varies based on cooling coil operation for the case of cycling fan/cycling coil (AUTO fan).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the fixed convergence tolerance for the iterative calculations?
output: The convergence tolerance is fixed at 0.001.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for Tolerance?
output: Tolerance \\equiv \\fracFurnaceHeatingLoad - Q_furnaceFurnaceHeatingLoad \\leq 0.001

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if the furnace is specified with cycling fan/cycling coil (AUTO fan) and high humidity control has not been specified?
output: The furnace's operating supply air mass flow rate is multiplied by PartLoadRatio to determine the average air mass flow rate for the system simulation time step.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What do the air conditions at nodes downstream of the cooling coil represent when the coil is operating?
output: The air conditions represent the full-load (steady-state) values.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What conditions are the equations referring to?
output: The equations refer to heating coil OFF conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for the sensible cooling energy rate when the coil is off?
output: \\( \\Delta_sencoil~off = \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outcoil~off - h_Zone~Inlet_HRmin + \\PB\\dotm_coil~off - \\frac\\dotm_Zone~InletFrac \\PBh_Outcoil~off - h_Control~Zone_HRmin \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How is the part-load ratio for the furnace estimated?
output: With the calculated sensible cooling energy rates and the total sensible cooling load to be met by the system the part-load ratio for the furnace is estimated.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for calculating the part-load ratio?
output: PartLoadRatio = MAX\\left( 0.0\\fracABS\\left( FurnaceCoolingLoad - NoCoolOutput \\right)ABS\\left( FullCoolOutput - NoCoolOutput \\right) \\right)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: Why is the part-load performance of the DX cooling coil frequently non-linear?
output: The part-load performance of the DX cooling coil is frequently non-linear due to the supply air fan heat varying based on cooling coil operation for the case of cycling fan/cycling coil (AUTO fan).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How are the final part-load ratio for the cooling coil compressor and fan determined?
output: They are determined through iterative calculations until the furnace's cooling output matches the cooling load to be met within the convergence tolerance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the fixed convergence tolerance?
output: The convergence tolerance is fixed at 0.001.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> equation
input: What is the equation for calculating the tolerance?
output: Tolerance \\equiv \\fracFurnaceHeatingLoad - Q_furnaceFurnaceHeatingLoad \\leq 0.001

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if the furnace has been specified with cycling fan/cycling coil and high humidity control has not been specified?
output: The furnace's operating supply air mass flow rate is multiplied by PartLoadRatio to determine the average air mass flow rate for the system simulation time step.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What do the air conditions at nodes downstream of the cooling coil represent when the cooling coil is operating?
output: They represent the full-load (steady-state) values.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How is the average air mass flow rate calculated if a cycling fan is used and high humidity control has been specified?
output: It is based on the greater of the heating or cooling part-load ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens when the heating part-load ratio is greater than the cooling part-load ratio?
output: The air conditions at nodes downstream of the cooling coil represent the weighted average of full-load conditions when the cooling coil is operating and inlet air conditions when the cooling coil is off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens if the supply air fan is specified to run continuously?
output: The air mass flow rate continues to operate at the user-specified supply air mass flow rate when no cooling or heating is required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How are the furnace exiting air conditions and energy consumption calculated?
output: They are calculated and reported by the individual component models (fan and DX cooling coil).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is an optional feature that can be specified with the HeatCool configuration?
output: An optional reheat coil can be specified with the HeatCool configuration to allow the furnace to control high zone humidity levels.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/engineering-reference/media/
input: What does Figure~\\reffig:schematic-for-blow-through-furnace-with-high show?
output: Figure~\\reffig:schematic-for-blow-through-furnace-with-high shows the specific configuration of the HeatCool Furnace with high humidity control option.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: Where is the fan located if a draw through fan is specified?
output: If a draw through fan is specified the fan is located between the heating coil and the reheat coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What is the system controlled to keep when using ZoneControl:Humidistat?
output: The system is controlled to keep the relative humidity in the control zone from exceeding the setpoint specified in the object ZoneControl:Humidistat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How is the average air mass flow rate calculated when humidity control has been specified?
output: The calculation of average air mass flow rate is based on the greater of the heating or cooling part-load ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What happens when the heating part-load ratio is greater than the cooling part-load ratio?
output: The air conditions at nodes downstream of the cooling coil represent the weighted average of full-load conditions when the cooling coil is operating and inlet air conditions when the cooling coil is off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: What occurs if the supply air fan is set to run continuously?
output: The air mass flow rate continues to operate at the user-specified supply air mass flow rate when no cooling or heating is required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: How are the air conditions at nodes downstream of the cooling coil calculated when the supply air fan runs continuously?
output: They are calculated as the average conditions over the simulation time step.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: Who calculates and reports the furnace exiting air conditions and energy consumption?
output: The individual component models (fan and DX cooling coil) calculate and report these.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: What optional component can be specified with the HeatCool configuration?
output: An optional reheat coil can be specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/engineering-reference/media/
input: What does Figure~\\reffig:schematic-for-blow-through-furnace-with-high show?
output: The specific configuration of the HeatCool Furnace with high humidity control option.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: Where is the fan located if a draw through fan is specified?
output: The fan is located between the heating coil and the reheat coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: What does the system control aim to maintain in the control zone?
output: To keep the relative humidity from exceeding the setpoint specified in the object ZoneControl:Humidistat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: When is the high humidity control option available?
output: When the supply air fan operates continuously or cycles with the compressor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: What are the air conditions at nodes downstream of the cooling coil during cycling fan mode when high humidity control is specified as CoolReheat and the heating part-load ratio is greater than the compressor part-load ratio?
output: They are calculated as the average conditions during the duration of fan operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: What happens to air conditions at nodes downstream of the cooling coil when the heating part-load ratio is less than the compressor part-load ratio in cycling fan mode?
output: The air conditions are simply the full load (steady-state) values when the coil is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: How does the furnace operate when high humidity control is specified and the compressor operates?
output: The furnace operates at the cooling air flow rate when a zone heating load is present.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: How is high humidity control specified in the Dehumidification Control Type input field?
output: It is specified as either None MultiMode or CoolReheat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: When is MultiMode specified?
output: When a heat exchanger is used to improve the dehumidification performance of the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: What does the heat exchanger do when MultiMode is specified?
output: The heat exchanger will be activated when the sensible part-load ratio is insufficient to meet the zone latent load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: When is CoolReheat specified?
output: When a DX cooling coil is used to over-cool the supply air stream to meet the zone latent load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: What is the purpose of a reheat coil when CoolReheat is specified?
output: To ensure the zone temperature does not fall below the zone heating temperature set point.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: High Humidity Control with HeatCool Configuration -> text
input: What happens when a heat exchanger is used with a DX cooling coil and CoolReheat is specified?
output: The heat exchanger is 'locked on' to meet either the sensible or latent cooling load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Air System Compound Component Groups -> text
input: When does the supply air fan cycle with the compressor?
output: The supply air fan cycles with the compressor when the supply air fan operating mode schedule values are never equal to 0.
